==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|alt=渾沌,渾敦-archaic,混淪-archaic,渾淪-archaic}}

===Etymology===
Old Chinese *''guːnʔ duːnʔ''. The variant {{zh-l|渾淪}} suggests that this perhaps came from *''guːnʔ l̥uːnʔ'' ~ ''guːnʔ ruːnʔ'', from **''gruːnʔ'', from the root *''k(V)r''- ("to flow > to mix > to be turbid, chaotic").

Related to {{zh-l|餛飩|[[wonton]]}} and {{zh-l|雲吞|[[wonton]]}}.

Compare {{och-l|渾}}, {{och-l|混|rapidly flowing water; turbidity; confusedness; unclearness; big; whole}}, Korean {{ko-l|흐르다|to flow; to float; to fill}}, {{ko-l|흐리다|to be turbid, unclear, indistinct}}, {{ko-l|흐릿하다|to be vague, indistinct}}.
